title: What Investors Believe: Central Banks Have Their Backs
text: In a world of fragile economic growth where the odds of recession have been on the rise, investors are now convinced that central banks (CBs), led by the Fed, have their backs, as they see the CBs as “buyers of last resort.”

title: Economists call the Fed interest rate cut an ‘unwise decision’
text: The Federal Reserve’s quarter-point rate cut was too little for Wall Street — and too much for some economists. “The Fed’s decision today is like in the days when doctors bled their patients to heal them,” Chris Rupkey, chief financial economist at MUFG Union Bank, said Wednesday, calling the cut an “unwise decision.

title: The Fed getting a sneak peek at July’s job numbers isn’t a bad thing
text: The way things are supposed to work, the Federal Reserve shouldn’t have seen the job figures for July that will be reported Friday. Those numbers are supposed to be secret until late Thursday, when the head of the Federal Reserve is given a sneak peek.

title: Asian Central Banks Will Continue to Ease Policy, says AXA Investment’s Yao
text: Aidan Yao, senior emerging Asia economist at AXA Investment Managers, discusses South Korea’s July CPI and export data and Asian central bank policy. He speaks on “Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.”

title: Oil drops as Fed signals rate cuts may be limited
text: Oil prices fell more than $1 on Thursday, declining for the first time in six days, after the U.S. Federal Reserve dampened hopes for a string of rate cuts and Sino-U.S.

title: Cramer reviews the top July performers on the Dow Jones and S&P 500
text: "When you get days like today ... look to those July leaders for guidance, and, in some cases, you're going to find some solid buying opportunities," Jim Cramer says.

title: Asia set to trade lower after Fed dampens hopes of more rate cuts
text: Asia stocks were set to trade lower on Thursday after U.S. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell dampened hopes of further rate cuts later this year.

title: Asian shares seen falling on 'hawkish' Fed outlook
text: Asian shares were set to open significantly lower on Thursday as the U.S. Federal Reserve poured cold water on market expectations of a lengthy easing cycle after delivering a 25-basis-point cut.

title: Making Sense of Q2 Earnings Results
text: Q2 results have largely met expectations, with growth on the weak side and positive EPS beats about in-line with historical trends

title: The Federal Reserve cuts rates by a quarter point
text: The Fed cuts rates by a quarter point.

title: Here's what investors should be doing after Fed cut

title: President Trump blasts Fed after rate cut
text: Yahoo Finance's Jen Rogers and Dan Roberts discuss President Trump's harsh words for the Federal Reserve following a 25 basis point rate cut after the July 2019 FOMC meeting.

title: Why the Fed Cut Rates: To Try to Fix Last Year’s Mistake
text: Not a recession-fighting measure per se, but a recalibration of strategy, and a recognition that the world has changed.

title: Federal Reserve chief asked if he gave into Donald Trump
text: President Donald Trump had been publicly saying the Federal Reserve should cuts rates and they finally did so, cutting the rate a quarter-point.

title: Stocks plunge after Fed cuts rates for first time since 2008—here's what experts are saying
text: The Federal Reserve's interest rate cut changes the layout for U.S. and global markets, experts say.

title: Federal Reserve explains why they cut rates
text: The Federal Reserve lowered interest rates for the first time since the Great Recession in 2008 to help stave off the possibility of an economic downturn.

title: Trump says Fed Chairman Powell 'let us down'
text: CNBC's Eamon Javers reports on President Trump's response to the Federal Reserve rate cut.

title: Dow Jones tanks as Fed chairman raises doubts on further rate cuts
text: Wall Street got what it wanted from the Federal Reserve — just not enough of it. The stock market plunged Wednesday despite the Fed announcing its first interest-rate cut in a decade, as Fed Chairman Jerome Powell signaled that the quarter-point cut was an “adjustment” and not the beginning of a “lengthy cutting cycle.

title: Trump says Fed Chief Powell 'let us down' by not clearly signaling more rate cuts
text: President Donald Trump said that Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell "let us down" on Wednesday hours after the Fed lowered its benchmark rate by a quarter point.

title: S&P 500 posts biggest drop since May after Fed cut, Powell comments
text: The Dow and S&P 500 suffered their biggest daily percentage drops since May 31 on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates for the first time in a decade, but remarks by Fed Chair Jerome Powell dampened expectations for further cuts going forward.

title: Fed's Hawkish Rate Cut Suggests Fed Went Too Far in December, Economist Swonk Says

title: The Conflicted Fed
text: The Fed has refused to promise the market more interest rate cuts and with good cause, since policy makers remain highly conflicted on what the economy needs.

title: The two words from Jerome Powell that rocked the financial markets
text: Fed Chair Jerome Powell said the Fed's quarter point rate cut was a "midcycle adjustment," meaning it was not a promise of more easing to come.

title: Is Trump the reason the Fed cut rates?
text: U.S. President Donald Trump's repeated calls for easier monetary policy may not be what drove the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates on Wednesday.

title: Fed's Quarter-Point Rate Cut: Weak Global Growth, Trade Tensions, Muted Inflation Cited
text: Hearing from Fed Chair Jerome Powell that today’s rate cut is simply a “mid-cycle adjustment” appears to be disappointing the stock market, where some investors might have hoped for more hints of additional easing.

title: Dollar up, stocks fall after Fed cut; pound rebound stalls
text: The dollar index rose on Wednesday and stocks tumbled even as the Federal Reserve cut interest rates after Fed Chairman Jerome Powell said the 25-basis-point cut was not the same as the beginning of a lengthy rate cutting cycle.

title: How to Prepare for a Recession
text: While economic slowdowns are increasingly rare and typically short, we will go through one at some point. Here's what you can do to make sure you're ready when it happens.
